author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
small_description: A novel depicting the luxurious lives of wealthy New Yorkers during the Jazz Age.

author: Harper Lee
small_description: A story set in the American South during the 1930s, addressing racial injustice.

author: George Orwell
small_description: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime and surveillance society.

author: Jane Austen
small_description: A romantic novel revolving around the lives of the Bennet sisters in rural England.

author: J.D. Salinger
small_description: A coming-of-age novel narrated by a teenager named Holden Caulfield.

book_name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
small_description: The first installment in the Harry Potter series, following the journey of a young wizard.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
small_description: A fantasy novel following the adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
small_description: An epic fantasy trilogy set in the fictional world of Middle-earth.

author: Aldous Huxley
small_description: A dystopian novel portraying a futuristic society characterized by extreme technological advancements and conformity.

author: Dan Brown
small_description: A thriller novel featuring symbologist Robert Langdon, uncovering ancient secrets.

author: Herman Melville
small_description: A novel depicting Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge on a giant white sperm whale.

author: Emily Brontë
small_description: A passionate and tragic tale of love and revenge between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

author: Leo Tolstoy
small_description: An epic novel exploring the lives of several Russian aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Wars.

author: Arthur Conan Doyle
small_description: A collection of detective stories featuring the brilliant Sherlock Holmes and his loyal friend Dr. John Watson.

author: Homer
small_description: An ancient Greek epic poem attributed to Homer, telling the story of Odysseus's journey home after the Trojan War.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
small_description: A psychological novel exploring the moral dilemmas and inner turmoil of the main character, Raskolnikov.

author: Oscar Wilde
small_description: A philosophical novel about a young man named Dorian Gray, who remains youthful while a portrait of him ages.

author: Mary Shelley
small_description: A Gothic novel exploring themes of creation, identity, and the consequences of scientific experimentation.

author: Margaret Mitchell
small_description: A historical novel set against the backdrop of the American Civil War and Reconstruction era.

author: Alexandre Dumas
small_description: An adventure novel depicting the story of Edmond Dantès, who seeks revenge against those who wronged him.
